meanings.definition: A decorative border or edging on a garment
meanings.sent1: The dress had a lovely frill at the hem.
meanings.sent2: She sewed a delicate frill onto the collar of the shirt.
meanings.sent3: The frill on the dress made it look even more elegant.
meanings.sent4: Her outfit was a frill of lace and ribbons.
meanings.sent5: The frill added a touch of charm to the plain dress.

meanings.definition: An unnecessary extra feature or embellishment
meanings.sent1: The phone case had a frill that served no purpose.
meanings.sent2: The movie had too much frill, distracting from the plot.
meanings.sent3: The frill on the cake was over the top, but it looked fun.
meanings.sent4: His speech was full of frill, lacking substance.
meanings.sent5: The frill on the curtains was excessive, but it looked pretty.

meanings.definition: To add unnecessary details or embellishments
meanings.sent1: She tends to frill up her stories with unnecessary details.
meanings.sent2: He always frills his presentations with too many animations.
meanings.sent3: Stop frilling up the report with irrelevant information.
meanings.sent4: The chef decided to frill up the dish with extra garnishes.
meanings.sent5: The designer frilled the dress with sequins and beads.
